d415956deb14.description: Home to some of the best stories on medium. Look around, relax and enjoy one with a sip of coffee.
d415956deb14.name: The Coffeelicious
d415956deb14.shortDescription: Home to some of the best stories on medium.

paragraphs.text: What brings you joy? Feel free to share in the comments, it will bring me joy to read through them.
paragraphs.name: a081

paragraphs.text: Randomness. Surrendering to life’s funny ways. Getting on a bus with no destination. Landing in a city with no plans. I one time spent a whole night with a group of South Korean singers in Seoul, we went to karaoke, then food, then their studio and recorded with them. I met them randomly in my hotel lobby. I intentionally keep some days with no plans.
paragraphs.name: 374e
5d58
paragraphs.text: Connection. Especially with minorities, underserved communities or people going through difficulties. Letting people feel seen. Validating their experience. Showing them that they are not alone. Helping them see the hope. The faith. The grit. The power they have within.

paragraphs.name: 57aa
paragraphs.text: Friends. Being with close friends, who you can laugh with, admit your sins to and be fully yourself without any act. The friends you hold when they are in distress because they trust you enough to let go. The friends that show up when life is hard and sit there and listen. I owe my survival in this life to my close friends, and you know who you are. You my friends, bring me joy.
Silence. Silent meditation. Nature. Quiet Sunday afternoons with a book. Listening to the sound of the rain. In peace, I find joy.
paragraphs.name: 500c
56e6
paragraphs.text: One of the many gifts of experiencing the darkness deeply, is it allows me to experience the light more fully. Ten things that bring me joy:
What brings you joy? Feel free to share in the comments, it will bring me joy to read through them.
paragraphs.name: a081
a081
paragraphs.text: What brings you joy? Feel free to share in the comments, it will bring me joy to read through them.

paragraphs.name: 57aa
paragraphs.text: Friends. Being with close friends, who you can laugh with, admit your sins to and be fully yourself without any act. The friends you hold when they are in distress because they trust you enough to let go. The friends that show up when life is hard and sit there and listen. I owe my survival in this life to my close friends, and you know who you are. You my friends, bring me joy.

paragraphs.name: ab5b
paragraphs.text: Making others laugh. Nothing beats putting a smile on someone’s face. I self deprecate, I am sometimes inappropriate, I make witty jokes, I act silly, and love an audience. So far my audience friends love it.
Beautiful, inspiring and thought-provoking. And yes, I do fear the things that bring me joy because I fear the loss of them.
paragraphs.name: 71ed

paragraphs.text: Things that bring me joy:
Peace. The definition of it should truly explain why it’s something I enjoy experiencing and keeps me happy and uplifted.
paragraphs.name: d09e

paragraphs.text: Family. They can be a pain, but ultimately, they keep me on my toes, focused, accountable, and reminded that I am stronger than I…

paragraphs.text: Combine this with “my beloved!” Now there you’ve gone and done it…true intimacy and vulnerability…joy, fulfillment. Such an unbelievable high…a “soulmate” or so I was told we were…and I believed it, wanted it so bad, needed it even. It was true! At least for a time.
paragraphs.name: 313b

virtuals.subtitle: Then…an utter feeling of abandonment when they let you down…and they will. The real test though is…can you overcome that? Can you both…

11c810886b86.title: Yes! Riding an unknown bus, walking in an arbitrary direction in a city with no name, stopping at a…

paragraphs.text: Yes! Riding an unknown bus, walking in an arbitrary direction in a city with no name, stopping at a cafe simply because a stranger said it was good… note to self to do this more often.
paragraphs.name: 2ff4

592de6439e87.title: reading your article brought me joy — joy because it’s so refreshing to be reminded that social…

paragraphs.text: reading your article brought me joy — joy because it’s so refreshing to be reminded that social media and how we use it is up to each one of us — far too many of the things I read online seem to focus on what separates us, rather than what unites us. Thank you Jessica for bringing me some joy today.
paragraphs.name: 07ba

paragraphs.text: One of my greatest loves — stretching myself in nature—is a cluster of yours. This includes going into nature’s unknown, letting go of my perceived self-limitations, taking calculated risks, trusting/learning from/sharing with/teaching friends, surviving/thriving, celebrating…

paragraphs.text: My daughter. Being there for someone. Helping someone. Being scared…but doing it anyway! Falling down with failure…and getting back up, no matter how long it takes.
paragraphs.name: 2dca

paragraphs.text: Beauty. It absolutely amazes me how much, and what, is beautiful to me. Crying. Forgiving. The sky. Snow. A smile. A belly laugh. Empathy.
paragraphs.name: c380

7184e327c105.title: How has no one commented on this yet (from what I can see).

paragraphs.text: How has no one commented on this yet (from what I can see). I’ve traveled to the dark, dark darkness deep. It was nearly my final destination – no return ticked needed, thanks. I had a note ready scripted and everything. I needed to know the darkness made you see the light more fully. I get it now. But this is so important to know. Love saved me…
The beauty of nature.
paragraphs.name: 6bcd

paragraphs.text: Smiles on a baby’s face.
paragraphs.name: e3f2

paragraphs.text: The kindness of strangers.
paragraphs.name: c29a

paragraphs.text: The sounds of rain on the roof.
paragraphs.name: de48

paragraphs.text: A phone call or email from a friend, especially when it has been some time since I heard from that friend.
paragraphs.name: 94b0

paragraphs.text: I loved your article. Your joys are exactly mine!! My god! I don’t believe It, I felt I was reading an article written by me. Awesome. Let’s connect
paragraphs.name: 66c9

9204c3cd9f70.title: Empathy! Just listening, acknowledging, sympathizing…being there…no judging, not excuses, no…

paragraphs.text: Empathy! Just listening, acknowledging, sympathizing…being there…no judging, not excuses, no solutions…just empathy! So fucking rare and getting rarer I fear.
paragraphs.name: 1d18

202f2b84d4e1.title: I think this last part of “without any act” is the most important when being with friends who bring…

paragraphs.text: I think this last part of “without any act” is the most important when being with friends who bring me joy. I’ve gone through numerous friendships that I had to leave because I was hiding parts of myself or putting on an act. This is the kind of friendship that brings me joy. Thank you for sharing what brings you joy.
paragraphs.name: c1b3

paragraphs.text: There is so much in this life that brings me joy. I am very blessed and grateful. Sometimes it’s easy to overlook all of the good and only focus on the bad. Thanks for the reminders of the joy that is out there.

e60b0203aa2c.title: What gives me joy is joy itself, being fully awake in the present moment and feeling the deep base…

paragraphs.text: What gives me joy is joy itself, being fully awake in the present moment and feeling the deep base of happiness that underpins even the darkest moments. They always pass but the joy never does, knowing that whatever happens I have always come through and if I don’t then that is the end but neither of those ever diminish this deeply magically joyful…
paragraphs.name: b46e

paragraphs.text: THanks so much. I think this is a struggle we all have, especially when life gets to us and searching for the tiny beautys is a wonderful reminder that even when we look up from our toils that world is still beautiful and there are many wondrous joys to behold. It’s so easy to get lost in the criticism or the overbearing intellect and lose sight of the shimmer in life.

d9f87baff276.title: I read the fears piece and I liked it.

paragraphs.text: I read the fears piece and I liked it. I love this joy piece and agree with all ten. I’m going to reflect quietly and find my own. I’ll start with these three: writing, coaching, music. Thank you for this prompt!

fbb0fcea0f5e.title: “After being single for years, I am now learning to love again.

paragraphs.text: “After being single for years, I am now learning to love again. While it is a relatively new relationship, the intimacy both physical and emotional we have together, brings me into the present moment, and opens my heart in ways I did not know were possible.”

paragraphs.text: Nice reflection. This is a question I often ask in my work as a hospital chaplain. I did not think, as Brene Brown shared, of joy as a “terrifying emotion”. I do know that connecting with joy plays a major role in healing and wholeness.
paragraphs.name: e89e
